Legal_Issue: Whether use of 'Zircotex-Fix' constitutes use of the registered mark 'Zircotex'
Evidence_Assessment: Initial lack of evidence of use; additional evidence submitted showing 'Zircotex' on shipping tape
Burden_of_Proof: On trademark owner to demonstrate use during relevant period
Credibility_Factor: Affidavits and supporting documentation accepted as credible
Legal_Rule: A registered trademark must be used in its registered form or in a way that retains its identity and recognizability
Standard_of_Review: Practical test established by case law for trademark use
Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and sufficiency of evidence submission
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of expunging registration due to non-use
Review_Standard: Substantial evidence meeting practical use standard
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Opportunity to submit additional evidence granted
Key_Evidence_Considered: Adhesive tape bearing 'Zircotex' used in shipping goods to Canada
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law under Trade-marks Act
Applicant_Challenge: Demonstrating genuine use of the mark 'Zircotex'
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated; Registrar initially found no use
Legal_Provision: Sections of the Trade-marks Act relating to use and maintenance of registration
Legal_Provision_Cited: Trade-marks Act provisions on use of registered marks
Applicable_Process: Ex parte appeal process with opportunity for evidence submission
Governing_Rule: Use must preserve the distinctiveness and identity of the registered mark
